sentences.en: But I was still Queen of Scots,so I came back to Scotland.
sentences.cn: 但是我仍然是苏格兰的女王，因此，我回到了苏格兰。

sentences.en: But where were the Scots from?
sentences.cn: 但是，苏格兰人又是从哪里来的？

sentences.en: Climate change may already threaten Scots pine stands in the Swiss Alps.
sentences.cn: 沿瑞士阿尔卑斯山气候变化已经威胁苏格兰松树.
试比较scottish 、 Scots、Scotch这 三个词.

sentences.en: Edward's imitation Scots accent is a standing joke around here.
sentences.cn: 爱德华模仿苏格兰口音,总是引人捧腹大笑.

sentences.en: He spoke with a Scots accent.
He used his column to spout ill-informed criticism of the Scots rugby team.
sentences.cn: 他根本不了解苏格兰橄榄球队，却在自己的专栏上对其大加抨击。

sentences.en: In Scots law an indictment is in more narrative form.
sentences.cn: 在苏格兰法律中,刑事起诉书的格式更具有叙述性.

sentences.en: It is the story of my lady Mary,Queen of Scots.
sentences.cn: 它是有关我的夫人玛丽苏格兰女王的故事。

sentences.en: Poland provide the opposition for the Scots' last warm-up match at home.
sentences.cn: 苏格兰队在国内最后一场热身赛的对手是波兰队。

sentences.en: Scots-born Annie, 37, has recently re-launched her phenomenally successful singing career.
sentences.cn: 生于苏格兰的安妮37岁，最近复出，再度投身于其辉煌的歌唱事业中。

sentences.en: The English were heavily defeated by the Scots in the battle that followed.
sentences.cn: 英格兰人在之后的那场战役中被苏格兰人打得惨败.

sentences.en: The noun Scots refers to the Scottish dialect of the English language and Scotch is whisky.
sentences.cn: scots作名词时,指英语中的苏格兰方言或称苏格兰英语;Scotch则专指苏格兰威士忌.

sentences.en: The Scots have distilled whisky for centuries.
sentences.cn: 苏格兰人用蒸馏法制威士忌酒已有数百年历史.

sentences.en: The Scots like to ring out the Old Year.
sentences.cn: 苏格兰人喜欢鸣钟送旧.

sentences.en: The Scots subdued the environment with simple spades and strong arms.
sentences.cn: 格兰扁一度不适合耕作,倔强的苏格兰人,凭着双手征服了这片土地.

sentences.en: There are things you can express in Scots that you can't say in English.
sentences.cn: 有些话可以用苏格兰英语表达，而无法用标准英语表达。

sentences.en: This corresponds to the period of minority in Scots law.
sentences.cn: 这与苏格兰法中的未到法定成年期相适应.

trans.tran_cn: 苏格兰人，苏格兰语，苏格兰人( Scot的名词复数 )
trans.tran_en: any of the English dialects spoken or written in Scotland
